name: Rasberry Strusel Muffins
ingredients: 1 ½ c. unbleached all-­‐purpose flour 1 egg, lightly beaten
2 tsp. baking powder 1 ¼ c. fresh raspberries
steps: ¼ c. granulated sugar ½ c. (1 stick) unsalted butter, melted
¼ c. packed dark brown sugar ½ c. milk
¼ tsp. salt 1 tsp. grated lemon zest
½ c. chopped pecans 1 tsp. ground cinnamon
½ c. packed dark brown sugar 1 tsp. grated lemon zest
¼ c. unbleached all-­‐purpose flour 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line 12 muffins cups with paper liners.
Sift the flour, granulated sugar, brown sugar, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon together into a medium-­‐size
mixing bowl and make a well in the center 3. place the egg, melted butter, and milk in the well. Stir with a .
wooden spoon just until ingredients are combined. Quickly stir in the raspberries and lemon zest. Fill each muffin
Combine the pecans, brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, and lemon zest in a small bowl. Pour in the melted butter and
stir to combine. Sprinkle this mixture evenly over the top of each muffin. Bake until nicely browned and firm, 20-­‐25 min.
Mix the sugar and lemon juice. Drizzle over the warm muffins with a spoon. Serve muffins warm.
